utterance.speaker: JAMES
utterance.content: Damn it, Ahab, I’m trying to sleep!

utterance.speaker: JAMES
utterance.content: What is it, boy? There’s nothing out there.

utterance.speaker: JAMES
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you think it went?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Well, we’ll find out soon enough.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, my two favorite redheads. And what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We wanted to know how your anniversary went.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And we came prepared either way. Tears – – or … cheers!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Which one is it, kiddo?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, it was great. And when I say great, I mean after the last few weeks it was … great.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So does this mean you and Beckett are back together?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … well, no, this means uh … we’re making progress. And, you know, I’m going to keep the mojo going by wiggling my way into her homicide cases.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: Hello, all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, good morning.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, well look who’s here. Oh, I am so glad you agreed to consult with Richard. Maybe now this money pit will turn a profit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What – what was that, Mother?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, look at the time. We have to go, darling. Oh, Richard. I am so pleased about you and Katherine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Try not to blow it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Congrats, dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: We’ll see you later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Why are you lying to them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not – I’m not lying to them.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, good. So you did tell them that your anniversary was cut short when Beckett received a mystery text.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I might have left that part out.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Ah. Did you also maybe leave out the part where you asked me to come in this morning in order to hack Beckett’s cell phone to tell you who sent her that text?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, I know how that looks. But … something is going on with Beckett and I’m … worried about her.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I know. Okay, you go and do what you need to do. I’ll see what I can find out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Oh, uh … you know, Hayley, I set up the small office on the other side of reception especially for you.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Aww … I’m good here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But this is my office.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Of course it is. I shall call you if I find anything out. Have a good day.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … Vikram?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM SINGH
utterance.content: Surprise! Welcome to our new office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … a strip club? Really?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Hey, you said to find a location where we could hunt for LokSat without anyone looking over our shoulders.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and this is the best you could find?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Perfect. Vice raided the place, now it’s tied up in trial. We can operate here for months completely off the grid. Plus, I can work out my core.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, um, the text from last night. What did you find?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Actually, um … it’s a dead end.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: My bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you didn’t know this last night?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Um …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you text me to pull me out of my anniversary dinner with Castle?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Look, you broke up with him for a reason. No one can know what we’re doing, especially Castle. It’s … too dangerous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know! And I am being extremely careful. I’m just trying not to lose my marriage in the process. Beckett. Okay. I’ll meet you at the morgue. They found a floater at the 79th Street boat basin. I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Oddly validating.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Perlmutter. Oh, so you’re going full hipster now?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, have you starting jarring artisanal pickles yet?

utterance.speaker: SIDNEY PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Ah, you’ve come bearing jokes. Wonderful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we get an ID yet?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Uh, no. She’s a Jane Doe. Twenties. Contact gunshot wound. Looks like she was killed execution style and dumped into the water.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, wow. Sounds like a mob hit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: From who? Al Capone? That dress is straight out of the ‘20s.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Uh, it’s a costume, Detective. Property of Iconic Cruise Lines.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our Jane Doe must have been a cruise ship entertainer?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So she could have been killed on any ship in the Atlantic and drifted here on the currents.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Or not. Based on the modest level of blanching and bloating, the body’s been in the water less than 10 to 12 hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So whatever boat she was on could still be nearby. You know what, guys? Let’s start with –

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Now, hold on.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: It’s some kind of floss. It’s tied to her back molar. Going down her throat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, if that’s what I think it is, this Jane Doe could have had a side business smuggling.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A cruise ship is a good place to see drugs. International ports, a captive customer base.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe she got involved in a little onboard turf war and competition took her out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except why just one bag? I mean, if she was an actual mule we’d be pulling out twenty of those.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: At least.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I’ll put a rush on this at the lab.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meanwhile we need to figure which Iconic cruise ship our Jane Doe was on, because that’s our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I just got off the phone with Iconic Cruise Line. Our victim is Lara Madden. She was a dancer in their show called Speakeasy. Apparently she performed in it last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, that explains the flapper dress.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And the boat she worked on is an old Titanic-era themed ocean liner named the RMS Bently. It pulled into port at Manhattan cruise terminal at dawn.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm. Michigan ID?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You contact her next of kin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, her mother is flying in later today. She said that Lara quit her job at an environmental non-profit in order to work on the cruise line. All to help her family get out of debt.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Perlmutter just called. Turns out that baggie from Lara’s stomach? Pure uncut heroin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uncut? No wonder she only swallowed one baggie. That eight-ball has a street value of 30k.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uncut heroin comes directly from the cartels, so how does a dancer from Michigan get her hands on that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It could’ve came from anyone on the ship. Problem is, all of our suspects disembarked this morning.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Like, two thousand of them. They’re probably all over the city or flying back to wherever they came from by now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, why don’t you guys run the names from all the passenger and crew manifests. See if anything pops. I’ll head off to the ship, see if I can find an actual crime scene.

utterance.speaker: JANICE ELDEN
utterance.content: Here at Iconic we pride ourselves on two things: the old world elegance of ocean travel and our impeccable safety record. So I’m sure whatever happened to Lara was simply a tragic accident.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … well, she was shot in the head. So unless she tripped and fell on a bullet – – it wasn’t an accident. Now, I thought all your passengers disembarked this morning.

utterance.speaker: JANICE
utterance.content: Oh, those are some of the ship’s resident guests. Mostly retirees who live aboard year round. Uh, some of them, like the Nelson sisters, have been on the ship longer than most of the crew. We call them the gossip girls.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, I’m sorry, I have to get this.

utterance.speaker: JANICE
utterance.content: Oh, sure thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Vikram, what’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: We hit the motherlode. I ran the heroin found in our victim’s stomach. Beckett, it’s an exact, one hundred percent match to the heroin Vulcan Simmons was selling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Lara’s killer is linked to whoever took over Vulcan’s drug pipeline.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: This is it. What we’ve been waiting for. And do you believe it came from one of our own cases?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we have to be careful. We can’t let on that we know anything and blow our cover. And I’m not just talking about the target in the CIA.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Yeah. Good thing Castle’s nowhere near this one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ahoy! I’m the king of the world!

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Hello? Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This can’t be happening.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you get on board?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, we always talked about buying a boat. What do you think? I mean, I know it’s a fixer upper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe for our second anniversary.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know that anything is going to compare to the first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, you know … you really shouldn’t be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are we moving?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, I think your crime scene’s making a run for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Captain, you need to stop this ship.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ZIERING
utterance.content: That’s not going to happen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain, we’re investigating the murder of one of your ship’s dancers.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ZIERING
utterance.content: I’m under orders from headquarters to get underway.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you telling me that Iconic Cruise Lines is trying to cover up a murder?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ZIERING
utterance.content: I’m telling you the company’s near bankruptcy. They can’t afford the bad press.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop this ship. Or I will charge you with obstruction. I can call the Coast Guard to interdict this vessel.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ZIERING
utterance.content: Sure you can. But you know as well as I do that by the time you activate them we’ll be in international waters.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where US laws don’t apply. That’s what Iconic is counting on.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ZIERING
utterance.content: Oh, and just so the two of you know, they’re sending a boat to pick you up in about an hour.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we’ve got sixty minutes to investigate this murder before we lose access to our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ZIERING
utterance.content: And about that –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ZIERING
utterance.content: - I’ve been instructed to order the crew to not cooperate with you. Hey, I’m not losing my job over this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve got to divide and conquer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. I’ll talk to Lara’s dancer friends. They may be the last ones to see her alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but just remember, they’re not supposed to cooperate, so don’t tell them you’re working with the police.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where will you be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There are three Marthas on Lido deck. If anyone knows anything about this ship it’s going to be them. And plus, they’re not with the crew.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. If they’re anything like my mother you’re going to have your hands full.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Okay, heads up! So some rich guy bought the “Be Part of the Show” dance package for our next cruise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I promise not to step on anyone’s toes.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Are you Mr. Shermer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I boarded early in hopes of getting a little extra rehearsal time.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Well I’m not sure how you boarded early, Mr. Shermer, but we’re –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, please, actually Mr. Shermer is my father. Please, call me … … Jer … mi … ka.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jer-mi-ka.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Dave?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At your service.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Well, Dave, I’m sorry. Rehearsal’s not part of the dance package.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell you what. There’s uh … an extra hundy in it for you.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Places, everyone!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are we going to warm up a little bit? I thought –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - okay, gotcha. Um … uh, you know, a friend of mine bought the dance package on a cruise about a month ago. He said there was a dancer here by the name of Lara who was very helpful. Is she here today?

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Actually, Lara’s a no-show for today. But if you want to meet her you can ask her bunkmate, Bethany.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: So Dave, according to your questionnaire you have professional dance experience, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Definitely. Totally.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: And you studied the video we sent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, of course.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Perfect. So let’s take it from the opening number.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Opening number.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me, Bethany –

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Okay, let’s take this from the top, people. We face upstage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Upstage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: A -five -six -seven –eight. And walk. And hip. And left. And right. And travelling. And trio. And hip circle flick and hip circle flick. And here we go and ready for the dance break! One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight. Knees out, in, out, flick. Out, in, out, flick. Jazz hands.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Yes! There you go. Travelling stage left. And here we go … cakewalk!

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Nice, Dave. Good. Ready for the big lift … up!

utterance.speaker: DIANE NELSON
utterance.content: Lara’s down to earth. Not full of herself like some of those other dancers.

utterance.speaker: ELAINE NELSON
utterance.content: Oh, except for the last trip. I mean, she was distracted. She didn’t have time for our chats.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe she met someone new.

utterance.speaker: SHERI NELSON
utterance.content: Why do you want to know so much about Lara. Is she in some kind of trouble?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her name came up in a case. And I’m trying to figure out if she was involved with anyone on board connected with drugs.

utterance.speaker: SHERI
utterance.content: Not that I know of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Elaine? Is there something you want to let me know?

utterance.speaker: SHERI
utterance.content: Are you toking again?

utterance.speaker: ELAINE
utterance.content: All right, yes. And I score my weed from Isaac. Arrest me. Oh, no. Please, don’t arrest me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no. Who’s Isaac?

utterance.speaker: DIANE
utterance.content: Isaac Dern. He’s a bartender on board and I’m pretty sure that he and Lara liked to hang out together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Isaac Dern, history of drug and weapon arrests, plus he’s got an outstanding warrant in Tulsa.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But with access to ports around the world he could be tapped into cartels moving uncut heroin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This could be our guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Thanks, Ryan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You bet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Isaac Dern? Captain Beckett, Twelfth Precinct.

utterance.speaker: ISAAC DERN
utterance.content: I’ve got strict orders not to talk to the cops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. You don’t have to talk to me. I’ll just have Interpol pick you up on your outstanding warrant in your next port of call and we can talk then.

utterance.speaker: ISAAC
utterance.content: Okay. What do you want to know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell me about your relationship with Lara Madden.

utterance.speaker: ISAAC
utterance.content: We’re just friends. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s dead. Her body washed up last night. Did she steal your drugs? Is that why you killed her?

utterance.speaker: ISAAC
utterance.content: Wait, what are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know you deal drugs. We found your uncut heroin on her body.

utterance.speaker: ISAAC
utterance.content: Whoa, slow down. I sell weed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about the people that you work for?

utterance.speaker: ISAAC
utterance.content: I get my product from petty dealers at the ports. I’m not tapped in. And I didn’t kill Lara. I swear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night?

utterance.speaker: ISAAC
utterance.content: Here. Until 3AM. Serving cocktails to a bunch of drunk tourists. Wait, but I did see Lara after her show around 11 last night. She was still dressed in her costume rushing to the boat deck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was she with anyone?

utterance.speaker: ISAAC
utterance.content: Not that I could see.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: You ready to go again, Dave?

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: Let’s take five, people!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take five, people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re Lara’s roommate?

utterance.speaker: BETHANY
utterance.content: I thought you said you had professional dancing experience.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I was a professional … square dancer. A lot less cardio.

utterance.speaker: BETHANY
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listen, I’m not really Dave Shermer. I’m a private investigator working with the NYPD. And I’m sorry to tell you, Lara’s been murdered.

utterance.speaker: BETHANY
utterance.content: Murdered? Wait, what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know if she had a problem with anyone on the ship?

utterance.speaker: BETHANY
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Had she been acting unusually recently?

utterance.speaker: BETHANY
utterance.content: Yeah, lately Lara was spending a lot of her free time below decks in engineering.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know why?

utterance.speaker: BETHANY
utterance.content: She wouldn’t talk about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I go down to your bunk, just to look through Lara’s things? See if she had a diary or anything that might find her killer?

utterance.speaker: BETHANY
utterance.content: If Lara had a diary the last place she would keep it is in our bunk. Things get stolen all the time on this raggedy ship. We all have secret stash spots. Some of them are pretty creative.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have any idea where Lara’s stash spot was?

utterance.speaker: BETHANY
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you for your help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. You get anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A pulled groin and a potential clue. Lara spent a lot of time below decks at engineering. How about you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A bartender saw Lara after the show last night standing by the gantry 23.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she met someone for a drug deal and things went sideways.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe she was being followed. Either way I’m going down to the boat deck, see if she left any breadcrumbs behind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meet you there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s nothing here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it looks like the deck’s been cleaned. There’s no breadcrumbs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless … her roommate said that the crew stashed things all over this ship. What if this is the spot where Lara kept her stash?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She could have come here after the show, swallowed the bag before they put into port.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so where do you hide something up here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? I found the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer must have shot Lara here and then dumped her body overboard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, we are running out of time. We’ve got twenty minutes before we are kicked off this ship for good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, she was shot in the head so there should be a lot more blood. And there we go. Blood residue right here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It looks like the killer tracked footprints through it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, you know, can you put your shoe against it? Just for scale?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, we really should take a cruise. Imagine all the romantic secret interludes we could have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean like that scene in Titanic? The one in the old car?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Jack and Rose and the steamy window. We could just jump in one of these lifeboats and –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The lifeboats.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The lifeboats.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle. It would be tough to get in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about right here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That must be the uncut heroin.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Hey Acosta! They want you on B deck.

utterance.speaker: ACOSTA
utterance.content: I’ll be right there!

utterance.speaker: LARA
utterance.content: Thank God he didn’t see me. I don’t know what to do. I can’t trust anyone on the ship. I’ll just … grabbed some evidence for the cops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that must be our drug dealer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet you she was snooping around and discovered those drugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she was too scared to trust anyone so she decided to smuggled out a sample.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll bet she hid the camera before the show and came back afterwards.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She never made it. He must have seen her. He followed her after the show and then he killed her. We got to find her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fifteen minutes. Divide and conquer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Divide and conquer. Okay, go the dancers, see if they know who he is. I’ll go to operations deck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me. I’m looking for Acosta.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: He’s down there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Acosta. We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move. You’re under arrest for the murder of Lara Madden.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he wants an attorney.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The public defender’s office is sending someone over now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know, this guy is dirty as hell. He’s connected to the Lozeta drug cartel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, look what we found on him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He circled his prey. This is Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I take it that you’re not alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not at all.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You should probably make it back her. I found something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, I’ll see you soon. Sorry guys, I’ve gotta take off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, uh, Rick?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks for today.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was my pleasure.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett? Got a second?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I watched the rest of the footage from Lara’s camera. What I saw was disgusting and criminal but it had nothing to do with drugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh …

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: She was filming cruise ship workers illegally dumping trash out at sea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that’s why she was on the operations deck of the ship. She was making a documentary film.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Poor thing was trying to be a one-woman Greenpeace.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But she must have stumbled on a drug smuggling conspiracy moving heroin through the cruise line’s trash. That’s brilliant. Nobody looks into the trash moving in and out of ports.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: So all we have to do now is trace the pipeline back to our mystery man inside the CIA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, uh … start by finding the trash management company contracted with Iconic Cruise Lines. Clearly they’re a part of this. In the meantime I’m going to try to figure out who Acosta is working for.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Captain Beckett? Salvador Acosta’s public defender would like a word.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, sure. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: CALEB BROWN
utterance.content: Hi, Captain Beckett. Caleb Brown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi. Please, sit down.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I’m going to work on the old core.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: BROWN
utterance.content: So against my advice Mr. Acosta wants to make a deal. He’ll cop to second degree murder if you will recommend a reduced sentence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Second degree murder, really? Um, he’s going to have to give us something for that.

utterance.speaker: BROWN
utterance.content: Okay. Like what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like who he’s working for an where the heroin came from.

utterance.speaker: BROWN
utterance.content: What – what heroin?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Counselor, we have video footage of your client smuggling kilos of uncut heroin.

utterance.speaker: BROWN
utterance.content: Captain, my client insists that those were merely bags of spoiled flour. So unless you can produce any physical evidence, you don’t really have a case. And so …

utterance.speaker: BROWN
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. Second degree murder, no recommendation for reduced sentence. Take the win, Captain. Take it, because … we don’t, we don’t want to go to trial.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me guess, he offer you a deal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I told him I had to think about it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, there’s no way Acosta was acting alone. No way a cartel would leave a guy like that in charge of that much inventory.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Now we finally have the evidence to prove it. CSU finally analyzed that blood residue from the photograph you took of the crime scene. Check it out. There’s two different kind of footprints next to Castle’s shoe. Acosta definitely had a partner aboard that ship.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to find something solid to make Acosta roll.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, I have his cell records. There was a flurry of phone calls to a burner cell right before the murder. Acosta could have been coordinating with his partner aboard the ship.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll get in touch with the cell provider, see if we can ping that burner phone so I can locate it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And take apart Acosta’s life. Let’s check known associates. Anything that’ll point to who his partner was.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I figured out who sent Kate that mystery text last night. It was Vikram.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, Vikram? Our Vikram?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, it’s a secret messaging program between Kate and Vikram’s cell phones. It routes through proxy servers into an encrypted central server. State of the art spy craft.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But why? What are they up to?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I could ask the same thing of the two of you. Richard, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I told you, if you can’t tell your mother what you’re doing you should not be doing it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, when I was eight.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, exactly. And you should know better by now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My wife is in trouble. I have to know what’s going on. I have to help her. I have to protect her.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, you have to trust her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But it’s finally starting to make sense. Don’t you see, Mother? Beckett broke up with me right after Allison Hyde’s death. That’s also when she pardoned Vikram.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So we have to ask ourselves, what if Allison Hyde didn’t kill herself? What if she was murdered?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. By the same people who murdered Senator Bracken and Beckett’s former team at the AG.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And of course. Vikram used to work at the AG’s office. What if Kate brought him in to secretly help her investigate those murders?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you hack Vikram’s firewall?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Sure. But it’ll take a while.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard! Look, regardless of what Katherine is doing and why, are you sure that you want to do this? Because if she finds out that you are spying, you may just have crossed a line you cannot uncross.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She may just get herself killed. She’s left me no other choice.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: There’s always another choice.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So? What’s it going to be, Rick?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have to know, no matter the consequence. Do it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. You know that burner cell that Acosta called the night of the murder? It just pinged off a cell tower at 125th and Lex in East Harlem. Acosta’s partner’s in the city.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now how to find him. He could be anywhere within a couple mile radius within that cell tower.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We need to dig into Acosta’s life, see if he had any connections to that part of town.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll give Beckett the heads up.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Hey. The trash company that contracts with the cruise line is called Friendly Islands Sanitation. They have satellites in Latin America, the Caribbean, and north Africa.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, key points in the worldwide drug trade. So, somebody inside the trash company must have cut a deal with LokSat to move drugs through the cruise line.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: That heroin shipment Lara videotaped was offloaded with the trash the minute the ship docked in New York. It could be anywhere by now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we’ve gotta follow up the garbage, see where it went.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Castle.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Don’t answer it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … Hey Rick, what’s up? Have you decided to buy that boat?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, someone is in a good mood. You thinking about our naked time?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I am. I haven’t stopped thinking about it, as a matter of fact. Um … tell you what. How about round two, tonight, my place. No one has to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I can’t. I have to work tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … well, I thought being a captain meant you could delegate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you know what? I actually have to do a few things myself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe I can help. What are you working on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … captain stuff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, uh … … then good luck with your captain stuff. Bye!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yep, we got it. Her cell signal was our Trojan horse through Vikram’s first firewall. Now I can hack one server at a time until I find his central server.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Second thoughts?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Second, third, fourth. No. No, let’s keep going.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Everything all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, he’s just a little weird.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Well, normally he’s a lot weird, so – – in a charming kind of way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Check this out. Three dump trucks offloaded trash from our cruise ship this morning. All three left at 8:05AM, but only two showed up at the dump at 9:17.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the third one must have been carrying the heroin and then it stopped after it made the delivery. But where?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I’ve been scrubbing traffic cam footage but I lost the truck in Washington Heights.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pull everything we can on the truck driver.

utterance.speaker: COMPUTER
utterance.content: Alert. System breach. Firewall one.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Oh, we’ve got a problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Someone synched a RAT to one of my servers. Uh, remote access tool. We’re being hacked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? By LokSat?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve been so careful. How could they find us?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: They haven’t found us yet, just cracked the outer layer of our system. I’ll start an intrusion inspection, find out who our RAT is.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Uh oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: They’re on to us. Vikram’s trying to track our IP address.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you stop him?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. But I can slow him down.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: It’s coming from inside the city. Trying to narrow it down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Oh, you are good but I am better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cat videos? That doesn’t seem like LokSat. Who would do that?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: We’re about to find out.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: That barely slowed him down. I’m sorry, but he’s going to find us in less than a minute. Should we abort?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, we’ve only got two of the blinky boxes left to go.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, blinky boxes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just hack. Hack!

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Come on … got it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Castle’s office.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: He must be working with Hayley. She’s got the skillset for this and she is about to breech our firewall. If she does they’ll have instant access to our entire investigation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. That’s going to put a target on Castle’s back. We have to stop him.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I can do it but I need time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … let me see if I can buy you some.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Beckett calling. That’s Beckett – she’s calling. What do I do?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Answer it. Let’s see how much she knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey babe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Change your mind about tonight?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, you know, tonight’s still not going to work. But what about right now? Feel like steaming up your office?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My office? That sounds … great. I’m uh … … sort of in the middle of something right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? That’s too bad. Because I’m right downstairs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Downstairs downstairs?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I can be up in ten seconds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ten seconds … not long at all. Hang on – hang on – hang on one second. We’ve got to shut it down. She’s going to walk in the front door.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. She’s lying. Her phone is pinging from Queens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She knows it’s us that’s hacking her. Sorry about that, just taking off my pants. You coming up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He knows I’m lying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, uh … you know what? Something just came up. Rain check.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure. You know where to find me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: She’s almost in. I could launch a cyber nuke but it’ll completely fry his entire system.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s got a backup system at home.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Is that a go for launch?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no, no! Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What … just happened?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Armageddon, I’m afraid. Vikram just nuked the whole system. We’ve lost everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ve lo-

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I never liked that guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did they get in?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: No. Another second and they would have. Thankfully our location and all our files are still safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. For now. I just hope I didn’t nuke my marriage.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need to talk to Castle.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: No, that’ll have to wait. I found a garbage truck driver from Friendly Islands. His shift ends in thirty minutes. With Lara’s murder all over the news they might be circling their wagons. We’ve got to get to him now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I hate lying to him.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I know. But you’re doing it for the right reasons. This is our first real shot to get to LokSat. We have to take it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. Tell me about the driver.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: His name’s Sam Mackey.

utterance.speaker: SAM MACKEY
utterance.content: Wait, wait! Please don’t murder me, please! Who are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re the people who show when you screw up a delivery.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: No, I took it straight to the warehouse just like I was told.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Don’t lie to us. We were watching. You didn’t follow instructions.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Yes, I did! I went straight to the place in the Bronx. By the 3rd Avenue bridge. Just like the guy from Panama said.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you see anything?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: No! I stayed in the truck like I was told.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Who’s the guy in Panama?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know what you’re thinking, Sam. You’re thinking I’m not going to kill you and you are right. But you’ve been running drugs and that means the NYPD can seize everything in your life.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Want your kids to live out of a cardboard box? Because that’s going to happen.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I don’t know any names, okay? They paid me not to ask questions. And don’t involve my family. I – I didn’t have a choice.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I think he’s telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Sam, here’s what’s going to happen. I’m not going to arrest you. But if you get another delivery, you call this number.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: No, no, no. I can’t. They’ll kill me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They might. But if arrest you they definitely will.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Telling them about this conversation guarantees that your whole family will be wiped out.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I won’t say a word. I promise.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. Now, where exactly is the warehouse full of heroin?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: We’re too late. They’ve already moved the heroin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And there’s no street cams outside so we could see who picked it up Damn it, this was for nothing.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: No, no. We do have something. We find out who the main players are at Friendly Island Sanitation and the next time Sam catches a shipment we’ll – we’ll be there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Ryan. Hey. Okay, yeah. I’ll – I’ll be right there. They think they found Acosta’s partner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The cell phone belonging to Acosta’s mystery partner was used in East Harlem earlier today.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We tore apart Acosta’s life. He used to crash in an apartment in that neighborhood. The name on the lease is Leo Longarzo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Leo is a travelling salesman for an Ecuadorian import/export company.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well that sounds like code for a cartel lieutenant.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right. He travels all over the world, has no wife, no kids.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And it gets better. We checked the passenger manifest of the cruise. Longarzo was on that ship.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s our guy. All right, send uniforms to sit on his apartment, see if he turns up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate? We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, when I hung up my shingle as a PI I knew I’d have to follow some wives. I just never thought it’d be my own.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, why couldn’t you just trust me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you ask me that? I saw the text Vikram sent you last night. I thought you were in trouble. Instead I find out you’ve been lying to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was trying to protect you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From Allison Hyde’s killer? Yeah, it was easy to figure out once I realized you weren’t just looking for “me time”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: LokSat thinks that his cover up worked. That’s why he let us live. And if he finds out that I am still pursuing this he will kill me and anyone that I am close to. That’s why I had to push you away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The fact that you even think that breaks my heart. I’d walk into a tornado for you, Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I would die if I lost you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want to know what hurts the most? You could have come to me with everything, broken us up just like you did, only it would have been a cover, and together in secret we could have taken this guy down. Only that never even occurred to you because deep down inside you like being broken. And you need this obsession. And no matter what I do I can’t change that. Only you can, Kate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, uniforms just spotted Acosta’s partner going into his building. We’re going to go roust him – – but we can roll without you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, actually, I was just leaving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, no. Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have a job to do. And there’s no one better.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER ELLROY
utterance.content: Longarzo came in about forty minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anybody with him?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER ELLROY
utterance.content: No. He’s alone. And there’s no one else in the apartment as far as I can tell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. We’ll take it from here. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If this guy really is cartel he might have an arsenal up that apartment. Should we call ESU?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD! Hey! Stop!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get down!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gun!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Acosta’s partner could have brought us closer to LokSat. Instead he’s in the morgue. It’s all come crashing down around my ears and I’ve got nobody to blame but myself.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Ah. You were having a pity party. That’s okay. I’ll leave. But I will be taking a pretty juicy clue with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you’re messing with me I might shoot you.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Does that mean you want to hear what I’ve got?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Okay. I was able to trace the ownership of the warehouse where Sam Mackey dropped off the heroin. It’s a Cayman shell corp. I dug back into the articles of incorporation from ’99. You won’t believe who wrote up those documents. Caleb Brown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Acosta’s public defender?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Turns out Brown worked for a major corporate law firm back in the day. Pulled in mid six figures annually. Then he suddenly gave it up a few years ago to be a defender of the people.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the perfect cover. It gives Brown access to assets in prison and allows him to pass orders to dealers we’ve already caught.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Dealers like Acosta.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Brown told Acosta to take the fall for Lara’s murder so we would back off of the drugs.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: And Acosta obliged. That’s how powerful Brown is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we can’t go straight at this guy. He’s not a scared truck driver. This guy is a shark. And if he sees us coming LokSat’s going to burn all of us. We’ve got to track Brown’s every move. Nice and quiet.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: It’s going to take time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but if we do it right … he’ll lead us straight to LokSat.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: I thought you said lying is wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I did. It is. But … she thought she was protecting me.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Okay … so does that mean you can forgive her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Yeah, don’t take this the wrong way, Rick, but you don’t make any sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s because I’m in love. But … you wouldn’t understand that.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: So why are you talking to me about it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Touché.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Everything that you said, you were absolutely right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could you be more specific?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That our breakup could have just been a cover so that we could bring down LokSat together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I wish you would have come to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well I’m here now. So let’s do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not that easy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought that you would –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just take you back? In spite of what you put me through?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Castle, I am sorry. I hate that I hurt you. That was never what I wanted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you did hurt me, Kate. And what’s worse … you lost faith in me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I never – I need you, Rick. I didn’t realize even how much I needed you until this happened. Please … just don’t make me do this without you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you do realize I’m going to have to punish you first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Naked punishing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Very naked punishing.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Oh, you guys.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
